name: Hotel Roemer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself, husband and another couple stayed here from 30th April until 4th May.
reviews.title: Could stay here for longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 17 and our friends in room 11, which is in the basement. Our room was very spacious,clean and everything up to date. The room overlooked the back garden and could reach it from our room via a side door. The hotel is off on a quiet street and and could not have been better. There are 3 rooms on our floor- 16,17 and 18. I can be a light sleeper and the only downside was that the kitchen was beside our room and i heard the noise just before breakfast started at 7. But it did not affect my opinion of the hotel. The beds are SO COMFY and i did sleep well at night. The staff were able to book us into dinner at the Vondel just metres away on our first night - which was Queens's day.
reviews.title: Perfect!! Awsome hotel in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast could not have been better, everything you could want.Nice seating area and nice to sit in the garden for a pre dinner drink before heading out. The staff were all helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is very new, have a wonderful room and bathroom, in a perfect location and with very nice staf!! They were so kind and gave us all the good directions in the city! Our room was perfect, we had a jacuzzi and Nexpresso cofee! They found it was my birthday and send us a bottle of wine with a card! The hotel is located in a nice area with a lot of restaurants, cafes, etc.. and where is a lot of buses and trams to go anywhere you want! You also can go walking to Museum Van Goh (5 min walking), to the parks for ride a bike and for the streets with the shops! It's really close to everything! If you want to get something special and nice you can book this hotel for sure!!
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location (close to Leidse Plein and Vondelpark), excellent service, great rooms with very good beds, couldn't ask for more!
reviews.title: Great hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the decor....so cool! Great furniture and lighting and lovely bar area with a fireplace. The staff are awesome, really friendly and nothing is too much trouble. Our room was clean and stylish, perhaps a little on the snug side with no drawers for storage but we were offered a bigger room if we wanted to change the next day but once we got settled we didn't want to move! Cool touches in the room included an i-pod dock, espresso machine, LCD TV's in the bedroom and bathroom and a UK plug socket over one of the European ones! Sometimes could hear other people in their rooms but that didn't cause too much trouble. Overall a great place to stay in a nice quiet street!
reviews.title: Cosy Boutique Hotel

likes.liked: — The style and nuts in the bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of two hotels we stayed at for our week visit. It was a beautiful room, modern, with plush bed, flat screen TV (one in main room, 1 in bath), desk with internet hook-up, dining table and 2 chairs, jacuzzi tub, shower, etc. Spotless, non smoking and in new condition. Our particular room was next to a somewhat noisy supply closet. There is a small bar, breakfast can be purchased, staff was helpful. Close to all the musems.
reviews.title: Modern boutique hotel-great choice!

likes.liked: — Beautiful room, non smoking in hotel.
likes.disliked: — Our room was in a bit of a noisy location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Roemer is a small boutique hotel in a quiet area close to all museums and shopping areas etc.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

likes.liked: — Chic design, luxury bathroom, balcony, friendly staff, excellent service, cosy atmosphere, central
likes.disliked: — Breakfast, it's quality did not live up to our experience of the rest of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 21, a small (but executive king) room and in some ways a little cramped but the balcony with two chairs and small table increases the size of the room by a third with a lovely view over the back gardens of the nearby houses, it is Amsterdam afterall and only newly built hotels have large rooms in general. The room was sparkling clean, toiletries are of a good quality, the mini bar is well stocked, strangely though ours was missing sparkling wine/champagne. An espresso machine was in the room as I believe it is in most rooms but was not supplied with sugar or milk (a Dutch way of drinking coffee) and tea was not available either. I take it this is normal but when we asked for what we wanted,it arrived almost immediately with a smile and 'nothing's a problem' attitude. The room service menu is limited and only available until 11pm but it is a small boutique hotel so there are some sacrifices! Breakfast was a small dissapointment and the only aspect of our three day stay we were not happy with, but not sufficiently unhappy to complain. However, drinks are always served with snacks, coffee with tiny muffins and soft and alcololic drinks with beer nuts, a lovely touch.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were warm and friendly, Joost the evening barman is an expert at judging if guests want to be left alone or have company, chatting, suggestions for trips, restaurants etc. He makes a mean cocktail and is very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better-traveller from South Africa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed in the roemer several times for business purposes and for pleasure. The hotel is small and very personal. Rooms are great, remember amsterdam is a small city with often very small hotel rooms, but the roemer has absolutely made the best of it. only 20 rooms and all are different. They all have several tv's, ipod docking statioons and a nice nespresso machine. The bubble baths are a very very nice touch. This also goes for the tv in the bathroom!!
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is nice and friendly. Ask for a specific room...and they will probably help you. The bar is cosy and small. internetcomputers for free in the lobby, all in all a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Location and chic rooms

likes.liked: — Great location, close to public transportation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Roemer is in a great location to visit the Van Gogh museum and upscale shopping e.g. Hermes, Zegna etc. It's also close to an extremely tourist area called Leidsplein (sp.?) where all of the wacko's and drunks gather in the evenings. Anyway, we spent two nights at the hotel and it really looks great as you enter the bar/lounge area and then to their patio / garden area out back. The rooms are comfortable, the beds are solid and there is a Nespresso machine in the room which I found to be a nice touch. The staff were generally friendly but seemed disorganized. Either they were all new or just hadn't had sufficient experience running a small boutique hotel. The young man who checked us in was quite arrogant and was little help acting in concierge capacity. The woman working in the bar was a great help and very knowledgeable about local restaurants and bars. The hotel offered us complimentary breakfast for a couple of inconveniences that we experienced during our stay. This was a nice touch and the breakfast was great. Here is an example of the poor management. If your hotel is sold out you should plan for more than 8 people to have breakfast at 9:00 AM on a Sunday morning. Guests were arriving to the breakfast area only to find that seating wasn't available. There was also quite some confusion operating the espresso machine to get espresso drinks for the guests. Anyway ... It's a nice hotel. I would stay at Hotel Roemer again. ** Request a room with a balcony ** I didn't know this was an option until I went out back to see the garden area.
reviews.title: an absolute pleasure to stay at the Roemer

likes.liked: — comfortable modern facility, friendly/courteous staff, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at the Roemer during July and it was an absolute pleasure. Very stylish boutique hotel with very friendly, professional staff who know what customer service and satisfaction are all about. We reserved an Executive/King room over 3 months in advance at an excellent rate and we are glad that we did because the room rate kept rising as the Roemer's popularity increased (based on TA's popularity index). Today the cost of a 3 night stay would be double what we paid. The hotel is relatively new and at the time we booked was still establishing its reputation - that reputation is now well and truely established. We arrived mid aftenoon to a warm friendly welcome and after checking in were offered a welcome drink. While the room was a good size, the huge king bed took up a lot of space. This was compensated by a delightful large balcony with outdoor table and chairs overlooking the beautiful landscaped garden and outdoor courtyard. Unfortunately the weather was not the best during our stay and we made little use of this comfort. The bed was extremely comfortable with an abundance of huge pillows. The bathroom was very plush and practical with an enormous shower head and the added bonus of a small plasma TV to entertain while showering, or a long relaxing bath, after a day of tourist activity. The location of the hotel was excellent, in a quiet street with a short walk to Leidseplein and its many touristy restaurants, as well as a departure point for canal cruises, and a little further to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. The area is well served with trams, no's 1, 2 and 5 passing frequently to whizz you off towards the central station and other touristy areas. The staff were very helpful in providing directions and answering any other questions we had. After returning to the hotel after dinner on the first night we met the very friendly and personable barman who brought our welcome drinks as we sat by the fire in the lobby lounge. He also provided useful information to assist us with our planned activities over the next 2 days. After that we made a habit of having a nightcap from the cocktail bar each night and a chat with our friendly barman. The lobby also had 2 computers for the free use by guests which was very much appreciated. The only downside to this hotel, and it is only a minor one, is that breakfast is not included in the tariff, but you can partake for an extra 20 euro per person. As most others have reported in reviews of this hotel it was easier to wander into Leidseplein to enjoy a more economical breakfast. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam, which exceeded our expectations, and our stay at the Roemer was a major factor in ensuring that we were completely relaxed and comfortable while exploring the delights of this city and returning to a home away from home. After travelling though Europe for 6 weeks and staying in 6 hotels with superior/deluxe rooms and 2 apartments we agreed that the Roemer was right up there with the best.
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in July 2007. Smart boutique hotel in an excellent positon of the City. Close enough to walk to all the sights yet just off the main roads to provide a peaceful refuge at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great stuff and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Roemer is tucked back from the street near central Amsterdam. Easy to walk to major sites like the Van Gogh Museum and other major museums. Good restaurants nearby. The hotel staff are very friendly. The mini bar is complimentary as are a very wide variety of drinks down in the lobby that are out for the guests throughout the day. Lobby is quite small, but does the job. Keep in mind this is a "boutique" hotel.
reviews.title: Good for one or two nights, nothing more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rooms are quite small with very little closet space. Again, come here for a night or two. Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom is a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Great location in vondel park, stylish rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last time I've stayed here was a while ago but I try to get a room in this hotel each time I'm in town. The location is just perfect at Vondel park which is close to the busy Leidseplein, the shopping street Leidsestraat and the Rijks- and Van Gogh Museum. The rooms are in different buildings. They are extremely stylish (exactly my taste), clean, spacious and the beds very comfortable.There's a nice bar/restaurant which I unfortunately coulnd't try so far but I'll do my best next time!
reviews.title: Perfect for an Amsterdam weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for - great location, nice rooms and friendly service. Breakfast and drinks are included in the room rate. Great value for money. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Amazing location just near the Vondelpark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small elegant hotel with a great location, just near the Vondelpark. It is so comfortable to be at only 10 minute walk from the busiest area of the city but having near a beautiful park where you can just go and relax. The room which they gave us was large and comfortable and we didn't expect to have a Nespresso coffee machine. The bathroom is spacious and the double shower was really very comfortable. Suggested to people who love small hotels in city center but not too close to the busiest part of it.
reviews.title: Too many little details add up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been really nicely finished and in a great location - not too close to the centre of the tourist district but within walking distance of everything. The staff were friendly and helpful and overall we were happy with the stay.
reviews.title: Overall a good weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: However it was disappointing that the double bed was two singles put together - which has its obvious problems. Also our room was near the kitchen which was noisy first thing in the morning, slightly annoying on a break.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever
Good location, but pricey.
reviews.text: Small things can make the difference and although these didn't cause great problem they could be better, especially as it is a more expensive hotel and we had paid for an upgraded room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Given these small issues we had a really nice time and would recommend the hotel... And it is the only hotel I've ever been to where there is whisky and vodka available at your leisure in the rooms and foyer!
reviews.title: Clean hotel in fun area. Will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed there for 10 days, excellent location, It's 3 minutes walking to the heart of Amsterdam, nice neighbourhood, i was staying in room 30 , and perfect team very friendly, next year i will stay there for sure. Thank you Roemer Team for this lovely vacation,
reviews.title: Good location, beautiful atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were put in this hotel by the JL No76 (they did not give us a room, although we had a reservation there).
reviews.title: Nice hotel near to city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we were in Roemer. The people there were busy and polite, so we had no complaint about the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and nice. It's a so called boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is near to city so we recommend this hotel to any visitor of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam at this conveniently located hotel. You can easily get to the canals and museums. The street was also quiet (our room was on the ground floor and no noise issues). The rooms were a decent size for a boutique hotel and nicely decorated. The staff was friendly and helpful. They do charge a fee for wifi per day and it was very slow.
reviews.title: Overall a comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a great hotel..arrived early..room wasnt ready but left our stuff and had a wander in amsterdam
reviews.title: wohoo!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed in room 28-massive bed, 3 TVs, ipod dock, dvd player-we love our gagets and throughly enjoyed the stuff given!
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

likes.liked: — everything, very helpful staff, and clean accomodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: great barman..had welcome drinks and was left alone if we wanted some "us" time
reviews.title: A delightful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: down side is that prob breakfast isnt provided..we werent so bothered but i guess if u pay around 250 euros per night for 2 people.....??should it be included
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.disliked: — Arriving late didn't please the girl at reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: also the hotel isnt geared up for food..it comes from its neighbouring hotel--there were some issues with room service...the menu was wrong..no food..cook was unwell...but , well..these things happen i guess...
reviews.title: Very original

description: In the past year Hotel Roemer has completed a total renovation. 23 spacious new rooms have been created, all of them equipped with air-conditioning, DVD Player, flat screen, i-pod loudspeakers and a espresso machine. Build in English and American adaptors assure a comfortable working environment for every guest. All rooms are individually designed with high standard design furniture combined with own designs.
